impact_assessments.signal_title: DeepSeek releases breakthrough AI training method mHC for efficient model scaling

primary_impacts.description: Reduced computational barriers democratize AI model development globally within 6-12 months

secondary_impacts.description: Emerging market startups and smaller nations gain ability to develop competitive AI systems without massive capital investment
US compute-advantage moat erodes, forcing strategic pivot toward architectural innovation and data advantages
Global AI talent redistribution: high-value engineers increasingly sought by Chinese and emerging tech companies

primary_impacts.description: Shift from compute-intensive to efficiency-focused AI development paradigm becomes industry norm

secondary_impacts.description: Environmental impact reduction as AI training energy consumption decreases significantly across industry
NVIDIA's competitive advantage in expensive high-end chips diminishes, creating market disruption

primary_impacts.description: Rebalancing of global AI power dynamics shifts advantage toward China in efficiency-based development paradigm

secondary_impacts.description: US accelerates export controls and tech decoupling to prevent Chinese leverage in efficiency-focused AI

cross_impacts.signal_title: TSMC revenue beats estimates, AI chip demand outstrips supply
cross_impacts.interaction_description: mHC efficiency breakthrough reduces chip demand growth rate while TSMC experiences continued chip shortage
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Market confusion: efficiency gains reduce need for chip capacity increases, but current shortage masks this effect. TSMC may face revenue plateau sooner than expected.

cross_impacts.signal_title: US-China relations enter 2026 with fragile trade truce, tech war intensifying
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Chinese AI efficiency breakthrough strengthens China's tech negotiating position, intensifies US concerns about tech decoupling
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Accelerates US decision to impose semiconductor export controls and AI talent restrictions

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: This signal represents a critical inflection point in AI development economics. The combination of mHC efficiency gains with global tech rivalry creates conditions for rapid AI democratization alongside increased geopolitical tension. The paradigm shift from compute-intensive to efficiency-focused development has profound implications for energy systems, chip markets, and global power dynamics.

impact_assessments.signal_title: CES 2026: Physical AI and humanoid robots dominate with 40 companies showcasing

primary_impacts.description: Industry-wide commercialization shift: Physical AI moves from research phase to manufacturing, logistics, and hospitality pilots in 2026-2027

secondary_impacts.description: Manufacturing employment undergoes first major displacement wave with humanoid robots handling dangerous and repetitive tasks
Industrial accidents and workplace injuries decline 20-30% as robots assume hazardous work
Supply chain resilience improves as autonomous robots reduce dependence on migrant labor

primary_impacts.description: Formation of physical AI ecosystem standards and competitive platform wars (NVIDIA Cosmos vs competitors) begins

secondary_impacts.description: NVIDIA establishes de facto dominance in physical AI software/models, creating platform lock-in
Boston Dynamics and competitors forced into strategic partnerships or acquisitions

primary_impacts.description: Consumer-grade humanoid robots begin entering homes for elderly care, household tasks, and companionship by 2027-2028

secondary_impacts.description: New social norms and ethical debates emerge around robot-human relationships and robotic companionship
Elderly care labor crisis partially addressed through robotic care assistants, but raises dignity and human connection concerns

cross_impacts.signal_title: NVIDIA introduces Cosmos physical AI models and Vera Rubin AI superchip
cross_impacts.interaction_description: NVIDIA's complete physical AI stack (chips + models + software) accelerates physical AI adoption timeline by 6-12 months
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Synergistic effect creates industry momentum. Companies that invested in CES demos now have development path through Cosmos ecosystem.

cross_impacts.signal_title: 2026 will bring widespread job shifts as AI agents automate work
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Physical AI robots combine with digital AI agents to create dual automation wave across physical and knowledge work
cross_impacts.combined_effect: 2026-2027 becomes inflection point where both physical and digital labor face significant displacement simultaneously

cross_impacts.signal_title: AgeTech becomes fastest-growing healthcare innovation sector
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Physical humanoid robots positioned as premium AgeTech solution for aging-in-place movement
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Baby boomer demand for aging-in-place solutions creates massive market for consumer humanoid robots

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: Physical AI represents convergence of multiple technology advances (computer vision, embodied learning, autonomous systems) reaching commercial viability simultaneously. The 40-company CES showing indicates industry consensus on market timing. This creates systemic shock across manufacturing, elderly care, and household labor. The interaction with digital AI agents creates dual-wave automation effect unique in economic history.

impact_assessments.signal_title: 양자컴퓨터 2026년 상용화 원년, IBM '강한 양자 우위' 선언

primary_impacts.description: Quantum computing transitions from theoretical promise to demonstrated utility with 2026 verified quantum advantage cases

secondary_impacts.description: Enterprise quantum adoption accelerates as companies move from experimental projects to production pilots
Quantum-specific cybersecurity threats emerge as quantum computers demonstrate cryptography-breaking capability
Massive quantum talent recruitment competition intensifies as quantum engineers become critical strategic resource

primary_impacts.description: Quantum computing market formation: standardization around 3-5 major platforms (IBM Nighthawk, D-Wave, IonQ variants) emerges

secondary_impacts.description: Industry consolidation accelerates with mid-tier quantum companies acquired or eliminated
Quantum computing becomes premium service offered by major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)

primary_impacts.description: Financial services sector embraces quantum computing for portfolio optimization, risk modeling, and trading algorithms

secondary_impacts.description: Market advantage for early quantum-adopting financial institutions erodes as quantum capabilities commoditize

cross_impacts.signal_title: D-Wave announces acquisition of Quantum Circuits Inc. for $550M
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Both signals indicate quantum computing industry consolidation accelerating with M&A activity and multiple platforms reaching commercial viability
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Dual signals confirm quantum as credible industry with real consolidation momentum, not hype

cross_impacts.signal_title: US-China relations: tech war intensifying over AI chips
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Quantum computing becomes new frontier in US-China tech competition if quantum advantage verified in 2026
cross_impacts.combined_effect: If quantum advantage confirmed, expect US quantum export controls and China quantum investment surge within 12 months

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: Quantum computing 2026 represents a potential inflection point in computational paradigms. Multiple independent signals (IBM prediction, D-Wave M&A, Korean media coverage) converge on 2026 as commercialization year. This creates industry-wide consensus that de-risks quantum investments. However, early quantum advantage cases may be narrow domain-specific applications, limiting near-term practical impact.

impact_assessments.signal_title: AI can now design proteins and DNA, scientists warn biosecurity rules urgently needed

primary_impacts.description: Democratization of biological design capability: novices can now create synthetic organisms using open-source AI tools

secondary_impacts.description: Biosecurity threats escalate as barriers to pathogen creation lower dramatically
Emergency biosecurity regulations implemented globally 2026-2027, restricting AI bio-design tool access
Scientific research community faces oversight and access controls on AI bio-design tools

primary_impacts.description: Dual-use technology governance crisis: legitimate beneficial applications (disease cures, agriculture) compete with biosecurity concerns

secondary_impacts.description: International AI biosecurity treaty negotiations begin 2026-2027 with slow progress
Biotech research funding and innovation slows as regulatory uncertainty increases

primary_impacts.description: Regulatory divergence: US, EU, China develop incompatible biosecurity frameworks for AI bio-design tools

secondary_impacts.description: Global biotech innovation consolidates in permissive regulatory jurisdictions (Singapore, Dubai)

cross_impacts.signal_title: CRISPR epigenetic editing breakthrough: gene activation without DNA cutting
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Breakthrough in safer CRISPR methods combined with AI-designed proteins creates powerful dual-technology advance in gene therapy
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Accelerates gene therapy development but exacerbates biosecurity concerns about AI+CRISPR combination

cross_impacts.signal_title: Trump administration issues executive order preempting state AI laws
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Trump administration's AI deregulation stance conflicts with urgent biosecurity governance needs for AI bio-design tools
cross_impacts.combined_effect: US federal AI deregulation hampers biosecurity governance during critical window when rules are most needed

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: AI protein design represents a critical wild card in 2026 with potentially catastrophic downside risk. The democratization of synthetic biology capability is largely irreversible once tools are open-sourced. This creates governance crisis: societies must simultaneously enable beneficial innovation while preventing catastrophic misuse. The window for governance action closes rapidly as tool proliferation increases.

impact_assessments.signal_title: 2026 will bring widespread job shifts as AI agents automate work, labor analysts warn

primary_impacts.description: AI agent automation begins visibly displacing knowledge workers in 2026 with administrative, analytical, and routine technical roles first affected

secondary_impacts.description: Entry-level and junior roles see 15-25% demand reduction as AI agents handle routine task execution
Wage stagnation or decline for roles subject to AI automation (data entry, basic analysis, routine writing)
Skills retraining demand surges as workers seek to move into AI-resistant roles requiring human judgment

primary_impacts.description: Workforce restructuring accelerates: job profiles shift toward AI-complementary roles and human-AI collaboration frameworks emerge

secondary_impacts.description: Organizational restructuring around AI agents: teams flatten, middle management roles compress
New role categories emerge: AI prompt engineers, AI auditors, human-AI interaction designers become high-value roles

primary_impacts.description: Political pressure mounts for social safety net expansion as visible job displacement creates policy urgency

secondary_impacts.description: Universal Basic Income and job guarantee proposals gain mainstream political traction 2027-2028

cross_impacts.signal_title: AI agents market to surge from $7.8B to $52B by 2030, 40% enterprise adoption
cross_impacts.interaction_description: 40% enterprise adoption of AI agents in 2026 ensures job displacement becomes visible and measurable
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Massive enterprise AI agent deployment combined with labor analyst warnings creates perfect conditions for 2026 as visible inflection point

cross_impacts.signal_title: Gen Z: 86% striving to reduce screen time, digital minimalism
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Gen Z digital minimalism movement conflicts with labor market demands for constant AI agent interaction and digital tool mastery
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Creates generational tension: younger workers want digital detox while job market demands AI agent expertise

cross_impacts.signal_title: Workplaces adopting email-free Fridays, mental health days, four-day workweek pilots
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Workplace mental health interventions may offset some anxiety from AI-driven job displacement
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Progressive employers use wellbeing policies as retention strategy amid job market disruption

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: 2026 marks potential inflection point where AI job displacement transitions from theoretical concern to visible reality. Multiple signals converge: 40% enterprise adoption, analyst warnings, AI agent market explosion all point to same timeline. However, new job creation in AI-related roles may partially offset displacement. The critical question is displacement speed vs. reskilling capacity.

impact_assessments.signal_title: Trump administration issues executive order preempting state AI laws, forms litigation task force

primary_impacts.description: US federal-state AI regulatory conflict emerges: Trump administration challenges state-level AI laws (Colorado, California) through litigation

secondary_impacts.description: 2026-2027 legal battles between federal government and states over AI regulation authority
Supreme Court likely rules on AI federalism issue 2027-2028, potentially blocking state-level regulations
AI companies receive regulatory clarity favoring minimal national standards over state patchwork

primary_impacts.description: US AI governance model diverges sharply from EU comprehensive regulation approach, creating bifurcated global standards

secondary_impacts.description: US AI companies face two distinct compliance regimes: light US standards + strict EU AI Act requirements
EU AI Act becomes de facto global standard as companies comply for EU market, then export globally

primary_impacts.description: AI Litigation Task Force establishes enforcement machinery to aggressively challenge state-level AI regulations

secondary_impacts.description: Progressive states and public interest groups mobilize counter-litigation to defend state AI laws

cross_impacts.signal_title: EU AI Act transparency rules take effect August 2026
cross_impacts.interaction_description: EU AI Act implementation intensifies contrast with US deregulation approach, hardening regulatory bifurcation
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Creates unprecedented regulatory divergence: EU transparency requirements vs US anti-regulation litigation

cross_impacts.signal_title: AI can now design proteins and DNA, scientists warn biosecurity rules needed
cross_impacts.interaction_description: US deregulation stance conflicts with urgent biosecurity governance needs for dangerous dual-use AI technologies
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Creates governance vacuum precisely when biosecurity regulations most critical

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: Trump administration's AI deregulation approach represents conscious strategic choice favoring tech industry speed over consumer protection. This creates permanent regulatory bifurcation between US and EU. For global tech companies, result is complexity: build one system compliant with stricter EU standards, then deploy globally.

impact_assessments.signal_title: US-China relations enter 2026 with fragile trade truce, tech war intensifying over AI chips

primary_impacts.description: US-China bifurcation accelerates: selective trade normalization in commodities (soybeans, metals) while technology sectors decouple completely

secondary_impacts.description: AI chip supply chains completely separate into US-aligned and China-aligned ecosystems by 2028
Global AI chip supply becomes geopolitically weaponized: Taiwan remains critical chokepoint
Allied countries forced to choose between US and China tech ecosystems, creating cold-war-like tech blocs

primary_impacts.description: China accelerates investment in indigenous AI chip and semiconductor capabilities to achieve tech self-sufficiency

secondary_impacts.description: China achieves parity with Western AI capabilities in 5-7 years through massive state-directed investment

primary_impacts.description: Permanent fragmentation of global tech supply chains creates efficiency losses but geopolitical stability benefits

secondary_impacts.description: Tech costs increase 10-15% due to supply chain duplication and reduced economies of scale

cross_impacts.signal_title: DeepSeek mHC breakthrough enables efficient AI model scaling
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Chinese AI efficiency breakthrough strengthens China's negotiating position in tech rivalry
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Accelerates US decision to impose semiconductor export controls

cross_impacts.signal_title: US plans new semiconductor tariffs on China starting June 2027
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Both signals confirm US-China tech decoupling trajectory with concrete tariff timeline
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Creates 18-month window for companies to restructure supply chains before June 2027 tariffs

cross_impacts.signal_title: TSMC revenue beats estimates, AI chip demand outstrips supply
cross_impacts.interaction_description: If US-China tech war intensifies, TSMC may face Taiwan security concerns affecting chip supply
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Taiwan Strait tensions create existential uncertainty for global AI chip supply

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: US-China tech rivalry represents fundamental restructuring of global technology architecture. 2026 marks transition from unified global tech ecosystem to bifurcated system. Taiwan becomes increasingly critical as sole place where US and China components converge. This creates existential vulnerability for global tech supply chains.

impact_assessments.signal_title: Gen Z: 86% striving to reduce screen time, 2026 becomes year of digital minimalism

primary_impacts.description: Digital minimalism transitions from counterculture niche to mainstream mainstream movement with 86% Gen Z participation

secondary_impacts.description: Workplace policies normalizing digital detox: email-free hours, no-meeting blocks, phone-free meetings become standard
Product design philosophy shifts: companies compete on 'attention respect' not feature maximization
Social media platforms face pressure to reduce addictive design patterns and algorithmic engagement maximization

primary_impacts.description: Mental health benefits of digital minimalism become institutionalized: insurance covers digital detox programs

secondary_impacts.description: Digital wellness becomes standard healthcare service alongside fitness and nutrition

primary_impacts.description: New market opportunities emerge around attention economy alternatives: analog products, digital detox services, attention-respectful apps

secondary_impacts.description: Dumb phone market resurgence: basic phones without internet become status symbol among Gen Z

cross_impacts.signal_title: One-week social media detox reduces anxiety by 16.1%, depression by 24.8%
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Scientific evidence validates digital minimalism movement, accelerating mainstream adoption
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Evidence-based support transforms digital minimalism from trend to standard practice

cross_impacts.signal_title: 2026 widespread job shifts as AI agents automate work
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Gen Z desire for digital minimalism conflicts with labor market demand for constant AI tool interaction
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Creates generational bind: want less screen time but job market demands digital expertise

cross_impacts.signal_title: Workplaces adopting email-free Fridays, mental health days, four-day workweek
cross_impacts.interaction_description: Workplace wellness policies directly support digital minimalism goals
cross_impacts.combined_effect: Synchronized cultural shift: digital minimalism + workplace wellness create mutual reinforcement

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: Gen Z digital minimalism represents fundamental values shift after two decades of digital saturation. 86% adoption threshold indicates crossing into mainstream norm from counterculture. This creates business model challenges for attention-economy companies (Meta, TikTok) and opportunities for attention-respectful alternatives. The movement is simultaneously spiritual (seeking meaning), health-focused (reducing anxiety), and cultural (redefining cool).

impact_assessments.signal_title: NVIDIA introduces Cosmos physical AI models and announces Vera Rubin AI superchip

primary_impacts.description: NVIDIA establishes complete physical AI platform stack from silicon to models to software, enabling industry-wide physical AI adoption

secondary_impacts.description: Robotics developers rapidly adopt NVIDIA stack, accelerating time-to-market by 6-12 months
NVIDIA lock-in effects emerge: robotics industry consolidates around NVIDIA ecosystem

primary_impacts.description: Vera Rubin AI superchip achieves production scale with significant performance improvements over previous generation

secondary_impacts.description: AI inference costs decline 30-40% as Vera Rubin efficiency improvements reach scale

primary_impacts.description: Industrial robotics and logistics companies pivot investment priorities toward physical AI adoption

secondary_impacts.description: Supply chain automation investment surge accelerates manufacturing labor displacement

cross_impacts.signal_title: CES 2026: Physical AI and humanoid robots dominate
cross_impacts.interaction_description: NVIDIA's complete physical AI stack enables the 40-company CES convergence
cross_impacts.combined_effect: NVIDIA platform + ecosystem lock-in accelerates physical AI market formation

impact_assessments.systemic_notes: NVIDIA's strategy in physical AI parallels their dominance in digital AI: vertical integration from chip to software creates unassailable competitive moat. Companies that build on NVIDIA stack face switching costs that entrench NVIDIA's market position. This represents significant competitive advantage but also creates industry dependency risk.

emerging_patterns.name: AI Governance Bifurcation: US vs EU Divergence
emerging_patterns.description: Fundamental splitting of global AI regulatory approach into permissive US model (Trump deregulation) vs comprehensive EU model (AI Act). Creates dual compliance burdens for global AI companies and potential regulatory arbitrage.
primary_impacts: Global AI companies must design for strictest standard (EU) to access largest markets
Regulatory compliance complexity increases permanently for multinational tech companies
Biosecurity and other dual-use technology gaps emerge between US and EU approaches
secondary_impacts: EU AI Act becomes de facto global standard as companies export EU-compliant systems
US startups face competitive disadvantage if constrained to EU-compliant design in US market
Emerging markets adopt either US-permissive or EU-restrictive model based on alignment

emerging_patterns.name: Physical AI Commercialization Wave 2026-2027
emerging_patterns.description: Convergence of multiple signals indicating physical AI moving from research to production deployment: CES dominance (40 companies), complete technology stacks (NVIDIA Cosmos), validated business models (logistics/manufacturing pilots). 2026-2027 becomes critical inflection point.
primary_impacts: Manufacturing employment faces first major humanoid robot displacement wave
Supply chain automation accelerates dramatically across logistics, warehousing, hospitality
New market for consumer-grade humanoid robots for elderly care and household tasks emerges
secondary_impacts: Platform lock-in effects emerge with NVIDIA ecosystem dominance
AgeTech market experiences rapid growth driven by humanoid robot demand
Social norms around human-robot interaction and robotic companionship begin forming

emerging_patterns.name: US-China Tech Bifurcation Accelerates
emerging_patterns.description: Multiple signals confirm permanent technology ecosystem split between US-aligned and China-aligned spheres. Selective trade normalization masks deeper technology decoupling. Taiwan becomes critical chokepoint.
primary_impacts: AI chip supply chains completely separate by 2028
TSMC strategic importance reaches peak vulnerability
Allied countries forced to choose between US and China tech ecosystems
secondary_impacts: China accelerates indigenous semiconductor and AI capability development
Tech costs increase 10-15% due to supply chain duplication
Global AI development splits into US-aligned and China-aligned innovation tracks

emerging_patterns.name: Quantum Computing Commercialization Year 2026
emerging_patterns.description: Multiple independent signals (IBM prediction, D-Wave M&A, Korean media, analyst consensus) converge on 2026 as quantum computing commercialization inflection point. Market formation and consolidation phase beginning.
primary_impacts: Quantum advantage verified in narrow application domains
Industry consolidation accelerates with major platform emergence
Enterprise quantum pilots transition to production trials
secondary_impacts: Quantum-specific cybersecurity threats emerge
Quantum talent becomes critical strategic resource
Financial services sector embraces quantum for optimization problems

emerging_patterns.name: 2026 Labor Market Inflection: AI Job Displacement Becomes Visible
emerging_patterns.description: Convergence of AI agent market expansion (40% enterprise adoption), labor analyst warnings, and knowledge work automation creates conditions for 2026 as first year visible job displacement felt across economy.
primary_impacts: Entry-level knowledge work displacement visible and measurable
Wage stagnation begins for roles subject to AI automation
Skills retraining demand surges across economy
secondary_impacts: Political pressure for UBI and social safety net expansion increases
Organizational structures flatten as middle management compressed
New AI-complementary job categories emerge faster than displacement

emerging_patterns.name: Digital Minimalism Becomes Mainstream Movement
emerging_patterns.description: Gen Z digital minimalism reaches 86% adoption threshold, crossing from counterculture to mainstream norm. Scientific validation, workplace adoption, and cultural normalization drive rapid proliferation.
primary_impacts: Workplace policies shift toward supporting digital detox
Product design philosophy changes to prioritize attention respect
Mental health benefits of digital minimalism become institutionalized
secondary_impacts: Attention-economy business models face mounting pressure
New markets emerge around digital wellness services and attention-respectful apps
Dumb phone market experiences resurgence

emerging_patterns.name: Democratization of Dangerous Technologies via AI
emerging_patterns.description: AI protein design enables novices to create synthetic organisms; AI bio-design tools are open-sourced. Creates governance crisis where biosecurity threats escalate rapidly while regulatory frameworks lag.
primary_impacts: Biosecurity threats escalate as barriers to pathogen creation lower
Emergency biosecurity regulations implemented globally 2026-2027
Scientific research faces new oversight and access controls
secondary_impacts: International AI biosecurity treaty negotiations begin
Regulatory divergence between US, EU, China creates governance vacuum
Biotech innovation may relocate to permissive regulatory jurisdictions

emerging_patterns.name: Energy Transition Acceleration: Policy and Deployment Momentum
emerging_patterns.description: Multiple environmental signals show energy transition moving from commitment phase to large-scale deployment: UNEZA $148B annual commitments, IRENA assembly accountability, renewable energy records in South Asia, US/EU policy support.
primary_impacts: Renewable energy investment acceleration creates construction boom
Direct air capture industry reaches critical mass for cost reduction
Developing countries leapfrog centralized fossil infrastructure
secondary_impacts: Energy transition financing becomes permanent infrastructure
DAC capacity scales toward gigatonne removal levels by 2030s
Distributed solar becomes dominant development pathway

inflection_points.description: AI automation transitions from theoretical threat to visible reality with 40% enterprise adoption and measurable job displacement
US-China tech bifurcation accelerates with concrete plans for supply chain separation
Global AI governance fractures into US-permissive and EU-restrictive models with fundamental incompatibility
Physical AI commercialization wave hits with visible workplace displacement

reinforcing_loops.effect: Lower AI deployment costs accelerate enterprise adoption beyond 40% by 2027-2028
Supply chain separation accelerates, increasing switching costs and entrenchment
Movement crosses from niche to mainstream, products and policies align to accelerate adoption

conflicting_tensions.tension_name: Digital Minimalism vs AI Labor Demand
signals: AI skill premium in labor market
conflicting_tensions.resolution: Likely resolution: Gen Z pursues AI expertise despite minimalism preference due to labor market necessity
Likely resolution: Emergency biosecurity regulations implemented despite federal deregulation push
Likely resolution: Efficiency gains delay but don't prevent chip shortage, masking demand reduction

wild_cards_and_unpredictables.description: AI protein design democratization could enable pathogen creation by 2026-2027, creating biosecurity catastrophe
wild_cards_and_unpredictables.mitigation: Emergency biosecurity regulations, export controls on AI bio-design tools, international enforcement

wild_cards_and_unpredictables.description: Commonwealth Fusion first plasma success could validate commercial fusion pathway, transforming energy sector by 2030s
wild_cards_and_unpredictables.mitigation: None needed; positive wild card with planning for grid integration

wild_cards_and_unpredictables.description: Trump China visit April 2026 could reset US-China trajectory from bifurcation to cooperation
wild_cards_and_unpredictables.mitigation: Scenario planning for both cooperation and competition tracks
